article:
{{Infobox Belgian political party | party_name = ProDG | party_logo = |
colorcode = orange | leader = Oliver Paasch | foundation = 2001 | ideology =
Christian democracy, [http://www.parties-and-
elections.eu/dg.html Parties and Elections in Europe: The database about
parliamentary elections and political parties in Europe, by Wolfram
Nordsieck] Regionalism | international = None |
european = European Free Alliance | europarl = None | colours = Orange, Blue |
cartel = | names = PDB-PJU and PDB | headquarters = Kaperberg 6, 4700 Eupen |
website = [http://www.prodg.be/ www.prodg.be] | }} 'ProDG' (Pro deutschsprachige
Gemeinschaft), is a regionalist and Christian democratic political party active
in the German-speaking community of Belgium. The party groups politicians from
the previous PDB and PJU parties. The party was formed in 2008 and figured on
the voting bulletins at first in 2009. Following the 2009 regional election, the
party won 4 out of 25 seats in the Parliament and participates in the regional
Government of the German-speaking Community of Belgium with two ministers. -
[http://www.deredactie.be/cm/vrtnieuws.english/news/090612_German_coalition
flandersnews.be June 12, 2009, Coalition accord in German-speaking
Belgium]
categories: Political parties in the German-speaking Community of Belgium
